attributes.action: Stop the addition of calories to menues in U.K. restaurants
attributes.additional_details: It’s estimated up to 3 million people in the U.K. suffer from eating disorders - adding calories to menues in hope of ‘decreasing obesity’ will only be of detriment to eating disorder sufferers, and others too. Calorie counting is a practice not encourage by dieticians, and should not be encouraged by the government. A more healthy alternative may be to help reduce the cost of nutritional foods.
attributes.background: The government recently announced their plan to add the calorie count of meals to menues in restaurants, this can be extremely detrimental and should be prevented.
